      • V

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphADT

        GraphADT​(int V)
        Constructor for setting up a graph.

        The constructor takes the input 'V' when it is called which corresponds to the number of nodes in the graph and stores it in the instance variable 'V'

        Then a new two-dimensional integer array is created with the x and y size of 'V' and stored in 'adjMatrix'.

        The constructor then loops through the whole adjacency matrix and sets the weights between all nodes to -1 which means that no nodes are connected.

        Parameters:
        V - The number of nodes in the graph

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge​(int src,
                    int dest,
                    int weight)
        Adds an edge to the graph.

        The method takes an integer for the source and destination nodes that an edge is to be added to and an integer for the weight of the edge.

        Then the relationship between the two nodes, in both directions, is added to the adjacency matrix with the 'src' and 'dest' variables corresponding to nodes in the graph and 'weight' being the weight.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        src - The integer representing the source from which the edge will come from.
        dest - The integer representing the destination to which the edge will go.
        weight - The integer representing the weight of the edge to be added.

      • getWeight

        public int getWeight​(int src,
                     int dest)
        Gets the weight between two nodes in the graph.

        The method takes the two inputs 'src' and 'dest' and uses them to get the weight of the edge connecting the two corresponding nodes in the adjacency matrix.

        Specified by:
        getWeight in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        src - The integer representing the source node that the edge connects to.
        dest - The integer representing the destination node that the edge connects to.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the weight of the edge between the two specified nodes.

        Specified by:

      • getLine

        private int[] getLine​(java.lang.String line)
        Gets a line from the graph file and returns an array of integers representing the source node, destination node, and weight of the edge.

        The expected format of the line is:

        "sourceNode destNode { 'weight': weightValue }"

        The method uses a regular expression to extract the required information from the input line.
        Parameters:
        line - The line from the input file containing a graph
        Returns:
        An array of integers representing the source node, destination node, and weight of the edge

      • getGraph

        public void getGraph​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads the graph data from a text file and constructs the graph accordingly.

        The method uses the File and Scanner classes with the 'getLine' method on the graph file to go line-by-line and populate the graph using the 'addEdge' method.

        Specified by:
        getGraph in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        fileName - The string containing the name of the file where the graph data is stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs when attempting to read the file or add edges to the graph.
        See Also:
        getLine(String), addEdge(int, int, int)

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getShortestPath​(int src,
                                                         int dest)
        Gets the shortest path between two nodes using the Breadth First Search algorithm.

        The method implements the breadth first search algorithm; starting from the source node 'src', exploring its adjacent nodes until the destination node 'dest' is reached.

        The BFS algorithm maintains three arrays:

        -visited: a boolean array that keeps track of all visited nodes.

        -parent: an integer array to store the parent node of each node in the shortest path.

        -distance: an integer array to store the distance of each node from the source node.

        The algorithm uses a queue data structure to explore the nodes. It removes a node from the queue, marks it as visited and explores its unvisited adjacent nodes. If a shorter path to a node is found, it's weight is updated, and its parent node is updated to the current node. The updated node is then added ot the queue.

        If the destination node is found during the BFS process, the algorithm stops and returns the shortest path from the source to the destination using the parent array.

        Specified by:
        getShortestPath in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dest - The destination node
        Returns:
        A list of integers representing the shortest path between the source node and the destination node
        See Also:
        getPath(int[], int)

      • getPath

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPath​(int[] parent,
                                                  int dest)
        Gets the shortest path from the source node to the destination node using the parent array.

        This method is a helper method that starts at the destination node and travels back to the source node, adding each vertex to the path as it goes. The nodes are stored in the path list in reverse order, so it must be reversed before being returned.
        Parameters:
        parent - Integer array containing the previous node for each node.
        dest - The destination node
        Returns:
        A list of integers containing each node from the source node to the destination node of the shortest path in order.
        See Also:
        getShortestPath(int, int)

      • getAllShortestPaths

        public void getAllShortestPaths​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> shortestPaths,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> path,
                                java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> parent,
                                int curr)
        Gets all possible shortest paths (same weight between the source and destination nodes and the same number of nodes).

        The method checks if the current node is the source node (if it has a parent or not).

        If it is, then it adds the path, stored in 'path', to the list of shortest paths and returns

        Otherwise, it iterates through all the parents of the current node and recursively recalls the method for each parent, adding the current node to the path before the recursive call, and removing it after the recursive call (after the path has been added to the shortest paths list.

        The process is repeated until the base case is reached and all shortest paths have been found.

        Parameters:
        shortestPaths - Nested list of integers that stores all shortest paths found
        path - List of integers where current working path is stored
        parent - Nested list of integers that contains all parents of all nodes
        curr - Integer representing current working node
        See Also:
        getPaths(int, int)

      • getAllParents

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getAllParents​(int start)
        Gets all parents of all nodes within the graph using Breadth First Search.

        The method uses the Breadth First Search algorithm on the graph starting at the specified starting node.

        Two arrays are used to keep track of the distance of each node from the start node, and whether or not a node has been visited.

        A nested list is used to store the parents of each node. Every element in the outer list represents a node, and the inner list represents the parents of that node.

        Then the method sets the distance of the start node to 0 and adds it to the queue and sets the parent of the start node to -1.

        The method then enters a loop where it dequeues a node from the queue and marks it as visited. It then explores each of the nodes next to the current node and then gets the distance between the node and its neighbour and then checks if the distance is less than the current distance.

        If it is, the method updates the distance and clears the parent list of the other parents of the node

        If the new distance is equal to the current distance then the method adds the current node as an additional parent to the other nodes in the nodes parent list.

        The method then returns the nested list of parents for each node.

        Parameters:
        start - Integer representing the starting node that the algorithm starts at.
        Returns:
        Nested list of all parents of nodes within the graph.
        See Also:
        getPaths(int, int)

      • getPaths

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getPaths​(int src,
                                                                  int dest)
        Gets all paths between source and destination nodes

        The method starts by using a helper function to get the list of parents for all nodes in the graph; getAllParents()

        Then it uses the parents list to get the list of all shortest paths using another helper function; getAllShortestPaths()

        It then gets the shortest path between the source and destination and node, and the total weight in that path using two other helper functions; getShortestPath() and getShortestDistance().

        The method then enters a loop to determine which of the generated paths in the shortestPaths list are actually the shortest.

        It starts by checking if the length of the path is equal to the length of the shortest path and if the total weight of the path is equal to the total weight of the shortest path

        If both conditions are met, then the path is considered to be a 'shortest path', and it is then reversed, so it's in the correct order and added to the result list if it's not already present.

        Finally the method returns the result list that contains all the shortest paths between the source node 'src and the destination node 'dest'.

        Specified by:
        getPaths in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        src - Integer storing value of source node
        dest - Integer storing value of destination node
        Returns:
        Nested list of all paths between src and dest
        See Also:
        getAllParents(int), getAllShortestPaths(List, List, List, int), getShortestPath(int, int), getShortestDistance(List)

      • getShortestDistance

        public int getShortestDistance​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> path)
        Gets the shortest distance 'total weight' in a path.

        The method takes a path list as an input, loops through all the nodes in the list and gets the weight between the current node and the next node.

        It then adds that value to the shortestDistance count and returns it once the loop has reached the end of the path.

        Specified by:
        getShortestDistance in interface GraphInterface
        Parameters:
        path - List of nodes represented as integers.
        Returns:
        Integer of total weights between all nodes in the path list.
